meta_description: The Albright-Knox Art Gallery is a vibrant museum in the heart of Buffalo’s cultural district actively collecting and exhibiting art since 1862. Experience something new every time.
hours_text:
#  Hours & Admission

The John J. Albright Bridge and Robert and Elisabeth Wilmers Building. Photo: Jason O'Rear

###  Museum Hours 

Monday, 10 am–5 pm   
Tuesday, Closed   
Wednesday, Closed   
Thursday, 10 am–5 pm  
Friday, 10 am–8 pm (until 9 pm on [M&T FIRST FRIDAYS](/events/mt-first-fridays))  
Saturday, 10 am–6 pm  
Sunday, 10 am–5 pm   
  
 _Closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays and Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day._

###  Admission

**General Museum Admission +**[**Special Exhibition**](/art/exhibitions/one-eternity-yayoi-kusama)  
Adults, $30  
Seniors (Ages 62+), $26  
College Students, $26  
Youth (Ages 5–18), $14   
Children (Ages 4 and under), FREE   
INDIVIDUAL, DUAL, and DUAL PLUS Members, $4  
ASSOCIATE Members and up FREE  
[**Reserve Tickets**](https://akg.ticketapp.org/portal/product/90)  
  
**General Museum Admission**  
Adults, $22  
Seniors (Ages 62+), $20  
College Students, $20  
Youth (Ages 5–18), $10   
Children (Ages 4 and under), FREE   
Members, FREE

*Available onsite only, General Museum Admission does not include access to [_One with Eternity: Yayoi Kusama_](/art/exhibitions/one-eternity-yayoi-kusama).

###  Free or Reduced Admission

Free general museum admission is granted to active-duty U.S Armed Services personnel and their families, [Arts Access passholders](https://www.asiwny.org/) and members of participating [Reciprocal Museum networks.](https://buffaloakg.org/support/membership/reciproca...

accessibility_text:
#  Accessibility

The Buffalo AKG Art Museum welcomes all visitors and is committed to making its programs and services accessible to everyone. For more information about our [Access Programs](https://buffaloakg.org/access-programs) and services, please contact Manager of Access & Studio Programs, Jenn Barton, at 716 270 8249 or [jbarton@buffaloakg.org](mailto:jbarton@buffaloakg.org). For general accessibility inquiries during museum operating hours, please contact Visitor Experience at 716 270 8292 or [info@buffaloakg.org](mailto:info@buffaloakg.org).

The Buffalo AKG takes pride in having an Accessibility Team that consistently strives to enhance the institution and establish an accessible environment for everyone. The team appreciates all feedback and aims to respond to any comments or concerns in a timely manner. To share a comment, please click [here](https://form.asana.com/?k=XdvzqHOVHlWFQFDqv9KVcQ&d=1143219038035898).

###  For Visitors with Limited Mobility

At the Buffalo AKG Art Museum, all galleries, entrances, and facilities are wheelchair accessible. 

Accessible parking is available at the loop entrance by the Seymour H. Knox Building. These spaces are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Accessible entrances, with power assist doors, are located on both sides of the Knox Building and on the ground and parking level of the Jeffrey E. Gundlach Building.

collections_text:
This video does not contain audio

Timed-entry tickets for [_One with Eternity: Yayoi Kusama_](/art/exhibitions/one-eternity-yayoi-kusama) are available now! Join us in the Studios for [Studio Art Classes](https://buffaloakg.org/studioclasses) suitable for all ages, make reservations for a meal in [Cornelia](/visit/dining), or check out the newest collaborations available in the [Shop](https://buffaloakg.org/visit/shop).

[View All Exhibitions](/art/exhibitions)
